page.title: 08KEMPSTON EMERGENCY SERVICES
page.content:
{A. THE TRAFFIC POLICE The Traffic Police Division at Halsey Road, Kempston controls the traffic in North Bedfordshire. They patrol sections of the M1, A1, A6 and A428, & escort wide and high loads on lorries. They cope with crashes. They help people to drive properly by being seen and by not exceeding speed limits.
{B. THE AMBULANCE STATION, KEMPSTON The station covers Kempston and outlying villages. It averages 18,000 calls a year. 17 ambulances are stationed there, with 32 people working shifts. New ambulances are used for emergencies. Older ambulances are used for day work, for taking people to clinics. The ambulances are seviced every 3000 miles and are sold after 5 years' use.
